example but I will say something particularly a fast company that we do a lot is we look for a story within your
story so the fact that your product exists might not be our story but the fact that your product exists because
you worked at a big tech company and realized that they weren't using this kind of data effectively and then you
started leveraging it in a totally new way that back story is more of something
that we would want to tell rather than just that you own a data company or that you're launching a new product if there
are people on your team with really interesting backgrounds if you are using
your product in a way you launched you know for one purpose and then you figured out that you could actually be a
great solution in a totally different industry stories like that are really compelling to us they're the kinds of
stories we want to tell so when you're pitching to us don't just think about how you want the name of your company
and what you do to be in our magazine that's not really gonna be something
that gets our attention think about this story within your story whether that's how your product was created who's on
your team what you guys are doing how you're saving the world think about think about the greater narrative of
